meanings.definition: To compose or perform music melodiously.
meanings.sent1: She loves melodizing on her guitar in the evenings.
meanings.sent2: The musician spent hours melodizing a new song for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seem to be melodizing along with her music.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the piano keys, melodizing a beautiful tune.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the violin melodizing through the room was enchanting.

meanings.definition: To add a melody to something.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys melodizing his poems to make them more engaging.
meanings.sent2: The singer is melodizing the lyrics to create a catchy tune.
meanings.sent3: She started melodizing her speech to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The wind chimes melodizing the breeze added a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The children were melodizing their play with joyful laughter.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or performing music with a pleasing or harmonious sound.
meanings.sent1: Listening to her melodizing brings a sense of calm.
meanings.sent2: The melodizing of the orchestra filled the hall with beauty.
meanings.sent3: The melodizing of the rain on the roof was a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The melodizing of the stream over the rocks was nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The melodizing of the choir echoed through the church, uplifting spirits.
